adrFormatAddress: 781 5th Ave, New York, NY 10022-1093, USA

editorialSummary.text: Upscale scene where an international crowd tucks into Italian food chased with Bellinis.

originalText.text:
Not worth the hype! Very disappointing experience. Being an avid traveler and trying many restaurants this is definitely not worth my time.

I went here to celebrate an event with my fianc√© and we almost left to go somewhere else after the first few mins.
Even though we had a reservation we were forced to wait- and not even at the bar which only had 3 seats and was being used by people to eat their meal at‚Ä¶
Once we got seated things only got worse‚Ä¶ plastic chairs? Am I at a high end restaurant or an office party? When asked the manager to change our chairs- which lets me say 90% of the other tables had nice comfy wooden n leather chairs- the manager declined.
We almost walked out- knowing we would be spending $300+ this is NOT how you treat your customers!!
Cocktails were terrible- please call it juice there is no alcohol and it‚Äôs not worth $26. A plain salad is $32. And as for the pasta- the bolognese and veal ragu were so greasy!
Very noise place, the only good thing I can say is the calamari and bread they served was not bad.
Only reason we went is because it is a major name and wanted to try what the hype is about. Clearly they pay people to write reviews, all their customers are old customers and they do not care about building a new client base. We will not be going back there are better Italian restaurants who have friendlier and better staff, service and quality!

originalText.text: Very disappointed!üòî not even close to the experience that we had at Cipriani in Lisbon. Food - very poor quality, not worth the price we paid, tasted pretty bland. Service was veeery far from good.  The only person who was kind and caring - lady who is woking at the wardrobe.

text.text: Very disappointed!üòî not even close to the experience that we had at Cipriani in Lisbon. Food - very poor quality, not worth the price we paid, tasted pretty bland. Service was veeery far from good.  The only person who was kind and caring - lady who is woking at the wardrobe.

originalText.text:
Bellinie (tiny and not fresh peach juice $25 too expensive?
Ravioli average swimming in butter $40
Calamari cooked in old oil $38 and served in salad plate.
My spaghetti with Chilenian
Bass $38 ( little pieces) was swimming in butter too, the dish was extremely expensive and came in a salad plate.
The server charged 20% of tip without notice. I did changed the % from 20% to 15%. I thought was abusive that he forced the 20% without my concent, my table was 3 customers only.
Very very disappointed,  will never come back. It's 10pm and I'm still burping my food.

originalText.text: This is now my second time dining at Cipriani's, and I had another wonderful lunch experience. This restaurant is located within the Sherry Netherland on 5th Avenue. The food and service were both outstanding. They served up the most unique chicken club sandwich ever. It was delicious. We will definitely continue coming back!

The food and service were both outstanding. They served up the most unique chicken club sandwich ever. It was delicious. We will definitely continue coming back!

originalText.text: Best grill duck ever I had it was special of day stew roasted duck . I have also burrata and chicken curry the service was amazing and fast I will come again.
